file_content.text: Good day, my lord.
I hope Naman Fal took the news well.
You should go. Talk to Naman Fal.
You found him? That poor acolyte.
He got torn up pretty badly in there.
It wasn't pretty.
Ah--he was so brave and ready to prove himself to his father.
Yes, yes--one dead acolyte.
Here it is.
Yeah, was that all?
His father is--was--Naman Fal. As I said before, he's one of the dark honor guards in the Academy.
If you take the acolyte's remains to his father, I'm sure he'll be grateful.
What exactly is a "dark honor guard," anyway?
Remind me about his father.
They are the Sith chosen from the most loyal and brutal shock troops to defend the Dark Council and the Emperor himself.
I suppose it's always good to make powerful friends.
Hopefully this will pay off.
A good idea.
Thank you. It's good to see that there are more feelings embraced by the Sith than just hate and fury.
You can find the acolyte's father outside the Chamber of the Dark Council. That's where he stands guard.
Good luck.
My lord, may I speak to you for a moment?
Acolyte, may I speak to you for a moment?
Sure, why not, sentry? Go ahead.
Fine by me.
[Flirt] Oh, you're attractive.
Oh, yes. Um, thank you. You're too kind. Really.
Go ahead.
Thank you. I am honored that you would do me the courtesy.
Begone.
Please, I didn't mean to offend. I just... wanted to....
There was an acolyte. Not long ago, he entered this tomb and did not come back. He... he died in there.
There was another acolyte--not long ago, who entered this tomb and did not come back. He... he died in there.
So what happened?
I don't know, but I could tell he was dying. I heard him scream even through the great tomb doors.
And you were worried to see a handsome man like me die too?
[Flirt] You're sweet.
No! I mean, not that--but that's not what I meant... I mean, it's just that....
And you were worried I might die as well? That's sweet.
You're a softie!
No! I mean, of course you would survive if you went in there. It's just....
Weak acolytes fall.
That seems even more true on Korriban, I'm afraid.
The acolyte who went in there, he--he was a good sort. Friendly and talkative. He said he was entering the tomb to prove himself to his father.
I just thought it would be nice if somebody took his body back and told his father he didn't make it.
Yes, the father should be told that his son has fallen.
That makes sense.
Are all sentries this stupid?
If you have no pity for the boy, think of the father then and the prestige you could gain from doing this. His father is a powerful man.
So go do it, you useless woman.
You've got legs.
So go do it already, you useless woman.
You've got legs.
So go do it already, you useless woman.
You've got legs.
I'd never survive in there, and even if I did, I wouldn't be allowed to see his father.
He is a dark honor guard stationed in the Academy. None but Sith can ever set foot on the sacred ground where he stands watch.
But you could find the body and bring it to his father. Please, do this and honor the fallen?
If I see the acolyte's body, I will try to retrieve it.
I'll give it a shot.
This dark honor guard better make it worth my while.
I expect a reward.
Of course.
Thank you so much. If you find the acolyte's remains inside the tomb, let me know--I can tell you where to find his father in the Academy. Good luck.
This is the tomb where acolytes take their final trials--I'm sure you'll be seeing it soon.
Good day to you.
